content.raw:
Changes to ign-math and SDF were described, but I didn't see anything about Gazebo. 

* Is the idea to parse all the transformations within SDF and keep the current interface with Gazebo? I'm afraid most information would be quickly lost in this case.

* What will the user see when they look at the pose from within Gazebo? Will there be an indication of the pose's frame? Or will the current behaviour be kept (in which case they will never be able to check if their SDF values were properly parsed)?

![pose.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RgX9je/images/3606417985-pose.png)

* Will there be a `frame` field in the [pose message](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/6bef1d4ac015b321e77a492d229308fcbfb8b54b/gazebo/msgs/pose.proto)?

* How about poses in the physics library? For example, [Joint::anchorPose](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/6bef1d4ac015b321e77a492d229308fcbfb8b54b/gazebo/physics/Joint.hh?at=default#Joint.hh-648) will still always be wrt the child link?
